Tina1.question: What value of 'display' makes a container a flex container?
Which property defines the direction of the flex items?

choices: Centers items with space before and after
Puts space between items and at the edges
Distributes items with equal space between them

Tina1.question: Which property is shorthand for setting both 'flex-direction' and 'flex-wrap'?
How do you center items horizontally in a flex container?
Which value of 'align-items' will stretch items to fill the container height?
The property 'flex-wrap: wrap;' allows items to move to the next line.
Setting 'align-items: center;' aligns items horizontally in a row.
'justify-content' controls alignment along the main axis.
A flex container’s children become block-level elements by default.
Flexbox is one-dimensional and works either in rows or columns.
The default value of 'align-items' is 'stretch'.
You must set width or height for 'align-items: stretch' to work.
The 'order' property affects the visual order of flex items.
The 'flex-basis' property sets the initial size of a flex item.
'flex-grow: 0;' means the item will never grow to fill extra space.

Tina2.question: What does 'display: block;' do to an element?
choices: Makes the element span the full width

Tina2.question: Which HTML element is block-level by default?
Which of these elements is NOT a block-level element by default?
What’s the default width of a block-level element?
How does 'display: block;' affect vertical stacking?
choices: Items stay on the same line
Each item starts on a new line

Tina2.question: Which property is often used with block elements to center them horizontally?
How do block elements handle height by default?
choices: They expand to fit content vertically

Tina2.question: Which CSS property can override 'display: block' and make an element inline?
What happens if you set 'display: block;' on a <span> element?
Which element is typically used to create sections and has block behavior?
Block-level elements start on a new line by default.
Block elements can have width and height set.
You cannot apply margin or padding to block elements.
Changing 'display' from 'inline' to 'block' will allow it to accept width and height.
'<div>' is inline by default.
'display: block;' elements stack on top of each other vertically.
An image () is a block-level element by default.
Using 'display: block;' on a <nav> tag will not change its behavior.
Block-level elements always center themselves automatically.
You can use 'display: block;' inside a flex container.

Tina3.question: How do you define 3 equal columns?

choices: Spans the item across columns 1 and 2

Tina3.question: What does 'repeat(3, 1fr)' mean?
choices: Repeat the first row three times
Repeat three columns with 1 pixel width

Tina3.question: What happens if you don't define columns or rows in a grid?
What is the default value for 'justify-items' in grid?
'display: grid;' creates a two-dimensional layout system.
You must define both rows and columns for grid to work.
CSS Grid supports fractional units using 'fr'.
Grid layout allows items to overlap using grid lines.
The 'gap' property can only set space between columns.
Items in a grid container can be placed using 'grid-row' and 'grid-column'.
You can use 'auto-fit' or 'auto-fill' in grid templates.
Grid areas can be named and referenced using 'grid-area'.
Grid layout is only supported in modern browsers with Flexbox support.
A grid item will always stretch to fill its grid cell by default.
